item.title: Scott Galloway says don’t aspire to be a billionaire because ‘it’s not going to get you anything’—here’s what to do with money instead of hoarding it
item.description: Galloway's advice aligns with research from Nobel Prize-winning economist Daniel Kahneman, who examined the relationship between income and happiness.

item.title: China says the U.S. used dozens of ‘special cyberattack weapons’ on the country’s time-keeping system
item.description: The ministry's statement could fuel tensions between Washington and Beijing.

item.title: ‘We would buy some beef from Argentina’: Trump’s plan to counter the flesh-eating parasite keeping red meat prices skyhigh
item.description: U.S. beef prices have been stubbornly high for a variety of reasons.

item.title: Wall Street might be panicking over private credit but insiders can’t see what all the fuss is about
item.description: Some say this is more about mudslinging between private credit’s competitors and a misunderstanding about direct lending.

item.title: Billionaire Bill Ackman says he doesn’t like ‘wasting money’—he’ll even drive elsewhere for cheaper garages, despite once owning a parking company
item.description: Pershing Square Capital founder Bill Ackman, worth $8.4 billion, turns off every light and gets upset at wasting money on the little things. Warren Bu...
